result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance D Pallesen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 06-01-2016 or serve 11 days jail, consecutive as penalty for non payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lance D Pallesen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lance D Pallesen in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
Count #1:
FINE: $316.00 to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 6/1/16 or serve 11 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.  
DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 to be paid at $50.00 per month consecutive to payment plan on fine. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lance D Pallesen in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers is requesting an adjournment for the hearing today and that the matter be set for plea and sentencing about 30 days.  The Court grants the request and scheduled accordingly.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-14-2016 10:00 am
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lance D Pallesen in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Attorney Weathers advises the Court the Defendant needs to enroll in AODA as part of the offer and requests an additional 45 days for the Defendant to participate in treatment.  The Court sets the matter for plea and sentencing but Defendant may only enter a plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing at 01-21-2016 11:00 am
Hearing at 12-21-2015 11:00 am
From Atty Weathers dated 11/30/15 requesting next court date be rescheduled.
Hearing at 01-29-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Lance D Pallesen in court with attorney Adam Schleiss for M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schleis advises the Court that Attorney Weathers is still waiting for discovery, offer and a complaint and requests a date in about 60 days.  Attorney Weathers to advise the Court how the case will proceed at the next hearing. Hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing at 11-30-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Lance D Pallesen in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant has advises the Court he has not retained counsel but would like to apply for representation at the public defender's office.  The Defendant is to apply right now and return to court.  The case is recalled with the same appearances.   The Defendant does qualify for representation and an attorney will be appointed.
Hearing at 11-06-2015 08:30 am
